name: black bear cub
description: A juvenile American black bear.  This one isn't much of a threat, but be wary of its parent; black bears are known for their protectiveness.

name: black bear
description: The American black bear.  A large omnivorous scavenger, it has powerful claws and jaws, and is an effective ambush hunter.  Most individuals are shy around humans, but they're fiercely protective of their cubs.

name: beaver
description: The North American beaver, the continent's largest rodent.  Its paddle-shaped tail helps ferry it through the water, and its prominent teeth can chew through wood, which it uses to build dam-like nests in lakes and streams.

name: black rat
description: The black rat, an omnivorous rodent with sheer black fur and a long, rough tail.  Harbinger of pestilence, famine, and mange, it will sometimes swarm over the dead or dying.

name: bobcat
description: A spotted wild cat living across much of North America.  It is not a serious threat to humans, but it can be aggressive when threatened.

name: cat
description: A small domesticated predator gone feral in the absence of human stewardship.  Harried by the elements and the rigors of survival, it is scruffy and skittish.

name: chipmunk
description: The eastern chipmunk, a tiny omnivorous rodent with a characteristic striped coat.  It spends much of the day patrolling its elaborate burrow and the precious stores of foraged food within.

name: cougar
description: The Eastern cougar, a large feline predator.  Once thought extinct in this region, conservation efforts were successful in restoring a thriving population.  Fast and silent, this predator can cover long distances with powerful leaps and pounces, catching its prey with its deadly claws before delivering the finishing blow with its enormous fangs.

name: calf
description: The domestic cow, a baleful, ruminating farm animal.  It is quite muscular, and the males can have a violent streak to accompany their nasty-looking horns.

death_drops.//: 25% chance of an item from group cow

name: cow
description: The domestic cow, a baleful, ruminating farm animal.  It is quite muscular, and the males can have a violent streak to accompany their nasty-looking horns.

death_drops.//: 25% chance of an item from group cow

name: coyote
description: The Eastern coyote, also called the tweed wolf, is a territorial canine descended from the offspring of gray wolves and true coyotes.  It is intimidated by humans and other predators, but it will still fight if threatened, and the Cataclysm has made it more fearless than usual.

name: coyote
description: The Northeastern coyote, a widespread canine pack hunter.  More timid than a wolf, it is an opportunistic feeder and prefers to hunt smaller and weaker prey, but is typically timid around humans.

name: fawn
description: A juvenile northern woodland white-tailed deer, a quick and strong grazing animal.  Favored prey of coyotes, wolves, and giant spider mutants.

name: deer
description: The northern woodland white-tailed deer, a quick and strong grazing animal.  Favored prey of coyotes, wolves, and giant spider mutants.

name: Labrador mutt
description: This once-average Labrador mixed breed dog has clearly gone feral.  Though it likely still instinctually trusts humans, it's probably far from domestic by now.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Labrador puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: bulldog
description: The American bulldog is a hardy, well built dog, that seems suited for surviving the apocalypse.
//: 7 puppies and 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless American bulldog puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

The oft-misunderstood pit bull is not actually a single breed but a label for several kinds of terriers.  It has average abilities, and is well-known for its 'lock jaw' - which isn't real, but their incredible determination is.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless pit bull puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: beagle
description: An adorable beagle that has managed to survive the apocalypse.  Being agile and small, they are difficult to shoot at.  Generally attacks in packs.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size tiny canines

description: An adorable, defenseless beagle puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: border collie
description: An athletic and hyperactive dog that loves to herd animals and jump, the Border Collie is an agile attacker.  Although they can be easy to train, they don't work well in packs.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Border Collie puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: boxer mastiff
description: An ordinary breed full of affection, the boxer mastiff doesn't otherwise stand out amongst other dogs with its capabilities.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless boxer puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: Chihuahua
description: It's a tiny Chihuahua.  How it has managed to survive is a miracle, although its small size and aggressive nature may have proven useful.
//: 1-3 puppies & 240 days per-litter for size tiny canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Chihuahua puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: dachshund
description: A wiener dog!  This awkward looking dog can be a useful watchdog, plus it looks adorable as it bumbles around.  Its tiny size also makes it hard to shoot (you monster).
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless dachshund puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: German shepherd
description: The original K-9 breed.  An easy to train and great attack dog that will also defend its owner to the death, however they don't work well in packs.
//: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless German shepherd puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

A large and powerful breed, the Great Pyrenees has a beautiful, thick white coat.  Originally bred to deter wolves and other predators, now faced with protecting livestock from shambling hordes of undead.
//: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Great Pyrenees puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: rottweiler
description: A terrifying breed to face feral, Rottweilers are descended from Roman legion mastiffs.  It's robust, vicious, and quite capable of mauling a human to death.
//: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Rottweiler puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

name: cattle dog
description: An agile and sturdy breed that is welcome on any farm, the Australian cattle dog is adept at leaping fences and herding livestock.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Australian cattle dog puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
A small omnivorous canine with an almost cat-like manner.  It is a solitary hunter, and one of the only canids able to climb trees.
The red fox, an omnivorous canine and largest of the true foxes, it is a wily hunter with a combative, suspicious temperament.

name: groundhog
description: Also known as the woodchuck, this ground squirrel has no actual talent for chucking wood.

name: jackrabbit
description: The snowshoe hare, a small grass-eater with a brown fur coat that changes to white in the wintertime.

name: horse
description: A hooved grazing mammal with a mane of hair, a sweeping tail, and powerful-looking muscles.

name: lemming
description: The Northern bog lemming, a small, predominantly vegetarian rodent that spends its life in the murk of swamps and other wetlands.  Contrary to popular belief, these creatures are not particularly hapless or suicidal, but they can eat themselves into scarcity within a few generations.

name: mink
description: The American mink, a partially aquatic weasel, once factory-farmed for its fur.  It is a capable fisher, but the presence of otters in these parts makes it rely more on food from the land.
The Eastern moose, the largest living species of deer.  While they aren't aggressive unless angered, the mating season can make the bulls quite ill-tempered.
//: Baby moose don't actually exist (yet), but autumn is their mating season so baby_flags is defined so that they get angry then

name: muskrat
description: A large omnivorous rodent with a thick furry pelt, found in wetlands across the northern hemisphere.  It marks its territory with a musky odor for which it is named.

name: gigantic naked mole-rat
description: A huge, rumbling mutated mass of wrinkly, nearly translucent skin that has been toughened by constant tunneling.  Its hide is riddled with giant scabs, as a pair of incisors the size of an industrial excavator's buckets gnash constantly and several car-length whiskers twitch in the air.  It regularly makes high-pitched chirps as it roams around.
//: Reinsert GOODHEARING when z-level tunneling is possible.

name: opossum
description: The Virginia opossum, a small omnivorous marsupial native to North America.  About the size of a cat, it is hardy and adaptive, and a fairly common sight in urban areas.

name: otter
description: The North American river otter is a shy water dwelling relative of the weasel, living in large families along the banks of streams.  It is an excellent fisher and a resourceful survivor, using the abandoned dens of beavers and other animals to raise its own young.

name: piglet
description: A domesticated omnivore descended from the wild boar, intelligent and inquisitive.  Left to its own devices, it has gone feral.

name: pig
description: A domesticated omnivore descended from the wild boar, intelligent and inquisitive.  Left to its own devices, it has gone feral.

name: rabbit
description: A small mammal with a cute wiggling nose, cotton tail, and made of delicious flesh.

name: raccoon
description: A small mammal native to North America, distinctive for its dexterous paws and facial markings.  It is resourceful and agile enough to open sealed containers with its paws.

name: rat king
description: A towering swarm of mutated rats, their tails knotted together in a filthy mass.  A fetid stench flows from its filthy presence.

name: sewer rat
description: A worm-tailed rodent with long whiskers and beady eyes.  The way it squeaks makes it sound...  hungry.

name: lamb
description: A timid, hooved grazing mammal, and one of the first animals ever domesticated.  Its body is covered in a thick layer of wool, and the males have long, spiraling horns.
A timid, hooved grazing mammal, and one of the first animals ever domesticated.  Its body is covered in a thick layer of wool, and the males have long, spiralling horns.

name: squirrel
description: A small granivorous rodent with a long bushy tail, often seen darting amid the branches of trees.  A skittish varmint with an expression of unwavering austerity, it is the mortal enemy of cat and dog alike.

name: squirrel
description: A tiny opportunistic rodent with a long bushy tail.  The pine squirrel is clever and cute, and hunted by nearly everything in the woods with a taste for meat.

name: weasel
description: The long-tailed weasel, a small but ubiquitous predator whose range extends across the continent.  It forms its den in small burrows, preferring to occupy the nesting holes of its prey.
A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the New England area, the wolf was successfully reintroduced and their numbers reached record highs in the decade before the Cataclysm.  Lucky you.
